oracle.pg.text

Interface OracleIndex<T extends OracleElementBase>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    OracleAutoIndex<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    OracleTextAutoIndex, RDBMSOracleTextEdgeAutoIndex, RDBMSOracleTextVertexAutoIndex

    public interface OracleIndex<T extends OracleElementBase>
    An interface extending the Blueprints Index interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  OracleIndex.SEARCH_ENGINE
      An enumeration listing the search engines supported for text search in Oracle Index

        Adds a new OracleElementBase into the index using all its associated key/value pairs
        Parameters:

      • buildSearchTerm

        java.lang.String buildSearchTerm(java.lang.String key,
                                 java.lang.Object value)
        Builds a search term query expression in the syntax required by this index.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the K/V property
        value - the value object of the K/V property

      • buildSearchTerm

        java.lang.String buildSearchTerm(java.lang.String key,
                                 java.lang.Object value,
                                 java.lang.Class dtClass)
        Builds a search term query expression in the syntax required by this index.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the K/V property
        value - the value object of the K/V property
        dtClass - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.

      • clearIndex

        void clearIndex()
        Clears all data stored in the text index.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this index object. This operation will flush and commit all changes executed over the index and free up its underlying resources.

      • commit

        void commit()
        Commit changes

      • count

        long count(java.lang.String key,
           java.lang.Object value)
        Counts all the matching elements that have a particular key/value property within the index
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        Returns:
        the count of matching elements.

      • count

        long count(java.lang.String key,
           java.lang.Object value,
           boolean acceptWildcard)
        Counts all the matching elements that have a particular key/value property within the index
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        Returns:
        a positive long integer representing the number of elements matching the K/V property.

      • count

        long count(java.lang.String key,
           java.lang.Object value,
           java.lang.Class dtClass,
           boolean acceptWildcard)
        Counts all the matching elements that have a particular key/value property within the index
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        dtClass - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        Returns:
        the count of matching elements.

      • get

        CloseableIterator<T> get(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.Object value,
                         java.lang.Class dtValue,
                         boolean acceptWildcard)
        Gets an Iterable object with all the matching elements that have a particular key/value property within the index
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        dtValue - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtValue is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterator object.

        java.lang.Class<T> getIndexClass()
        Gets the class associated to this index
        Returns:
        Vertex.class if this is a vertex index or Edge.class if this is an Edge index.

        Gets the name of this index
        Returns:

      • getParameters

        Parameter[] getParameters()
        Gets the OracleIndexParameters associated to this index

      • getPartitioned

        CloseableIterator<T>[] getPartitioned(java.lang.Object[] connections,
                                      java.lang.Object query,
                                      int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterator objects that hold all the elements with an attribute matching the given K/V pair. Each element in the CloseableIterator array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding shard. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the shards in the index with N shards. The subset of shards queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the search engine.
        query - the query object.
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        Returns:
        an array of CloseableIterator objects.

      • getPartitioned

        CloseableIterator<T>[] getPartitioned(java.lang.Object[] connections,
                                      java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.Object value,
                                      boolean acceptWildcard,
                                      int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterator objects that hold all the elements with an attribute matching the given K/V pair. Each element in the CloseableIterator array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding shard. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the shards in the index with N shards. The subset of shards queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the search engine.
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        Returns:
        an array of CloseableIterator objects.

      • getPartitioned

        CloseableIterator<T>[] getPartitioned(java.lang.Object[] connections,
                                      java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.Object value,
                                      java.lang.Class dtValue,
                                      boolean acceptWildcard,
                                      int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterator objects that hold all the elements with an attribute matching the given K/V pair. Each element in the CloseableIterator array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding shard. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the shards in the index with N shards. The subset of shards queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the search engine.
        key - the key of a property
        value - the value object of the property.
        dtValue - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        Returns:
        an array of CloseableIterator objects.

      • getSearchEngine

        OracleIndex.SEARCH_ENGINE getSearchEngine()
        Gets the search engine used by this OracleIndex object

      • getTotalShards

        int getTotalShards()
        Gets the number of shards (directories) in this index

      • put

        void put(java.lang.String szKey,
         java.lang.Object objVal,
         T e)
        Indexes an element by a key and a value.
        Parameters:
        szKey - the key to index the element by.
        objVal - the value to index the element by.
        e - the element to index.

      • query

        CloseableIterator<T> query(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.Object value)
        Query for all the elements satisfying the specified K/V property within the index
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the K/V property
        value - the value object of the K/V property
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterator object.

      • query

        CloseableIterator<T> query(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.Object value,
                           boolean useWildcards)
        Query for all the elements satisfying the specified K/V property within the index
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property. It MUST not be NULL. If the key is not found in the index, the result will be 0.
        value - the value object of the property. It can be NULL which will cause all elements with the given key to be returned.
        useWildcards - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterator object.

      • remove

        void remove(java.lang.String propertyName,
            java.lang.Object propertyValue,
            T element)
        Deletes the given property/value of the element from this index
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property to remove
        propertyValue - the value of the property to remove
        element - an OracleElementBase object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • remove

        void remove(T element)
        Deletes an element from this index
        Parameters:
        element - an OracleElementBase object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeAll

        void removeAll(java.lang.String key)
        Removes all the elements from the index matching the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to remove from the index.
